title: Why Android updates take ages to reach non-Google phones, according to Sony
description: ![AndroidPie]()### Alexa’s new whisper mode rolls out in US today – here’s how to enable it](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/how-to-enable-alexa-whisper-mode-echo-3607478 "Alexa’s new whisper mode rolls out in US today – here’s how toenable it")  * Once that’s done, you’d think we’d be ready for launch. You’d be wrong. First,the network operators like EE, Three, O2 and Vodafone need to get their handson the software, in case they need custom versions. Then, and only then, willthe software start downloading to everyones’ phone.Which is why, unless you bought a [Google Pixel2](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/google-pixel-2) last year, you’lllikely be waiting a few months for [AndroidPie](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/android-pie) yet. In the case ofSony, the [Sony Xperia XZ2](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/sony-xperia-xz2) and [Sony Xperia XZ1](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/sony-xperia-xz1) series will get it from November alongside the [Sony Xperia XZPremium](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/sony-xperia-xz-premium), butXA2 series owners will be waiting until early 2019.**Related:**[ **Best smartphone**](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best/best-smartphone-3431175)Although reading the infographic in full makes third-party phonemanufacturer’s tardy release schedule a bit more understandable, it doesinadvertently make the case for a purer form of Android without manufacturers’largely unwelcome bells and whistles.Speed of updates and guaranteed support (the lack of [Sony XperiaXZ](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/sony-xperia-xz) and [Sony XperiaXA1](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/sony-xperia-xa1) in the timetableis alarming) makes the case of going Google – or at least [AndroidOne](https://www.trustedreviews.com/opinion/what-is-android-one-2924502) –better than 100 adverts ever could.**Is getting a new version of Android quickly important to you? Let us know onTwitter @TrustedReviews.**
